bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 62 (Tuesday, April 28, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. BROWN of Florida:H.R. 2054.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 14To make Rules for the Government and Regulation of the landand naval Forces.[Page H2498]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

summary.text:
Directs the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to ensure that gender specific services are continuously available at every VA medical center and community based outpatient clinic.

Authorizes the VA to employ such personnel and enter into such contracts as may be necessary to provide such services based on the standards of the VA and the demand for such services.

bill.title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for increased access to Department of Veterans Affairs medical care for women veterans.

To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for increased access to Department of Veterans Affairs medical care for women veterans.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
